docs.text: 'bicentennial man' is a family film without any external motive with the exception of providing the minimum dose of entertainment .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: chris columbus , the director who gave you " mrs . doubtfire " , plays on sentimental strings and mushy dialogue to make his point .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: based on the short story by isaac asimov , it is supposed to be a science fiction story about a robot who wants to be human , which as you can imagine is very difficult .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: starting in a not too distant future the film concentrates on a wealthy family that buys an android to help them with the house and children .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: soon this robot , called andrew ( robin williams ) shows abilities that makes his owner mr . martin ( sam neill ) very curious .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: andrew is interested in art and music , he " enjoys " making clocks , which clearly shows that he has genuine emotions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it shows out that because of a small failure in the " electrical circuits " and " positronic brain " andrew has accidentally gained a soul .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this makes him unique and his evil creators worried .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then mr . martin decides to teach andrew all the things he wasn't programmed to do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: soon andrew wants to leave the house in pursuit of freedom , destiny and love .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this film can be described as a disney version of blade runner , a film that still shines as the biggest gem in the crown of science fiction .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ever since that film , the subject of humanity still stands as one big controversy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what makes us human ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the thoughts ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the emotions ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: is it possible to become human ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at what point can we say to a robot " now you are one of us " ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: these are very tough questions that require a serious and thurral approach .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is obvious that columbus didn't take them very seriously .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when you think about it , this film is not really meditating on the question " when is a robot no longer a machine , but a human being ? " , but tells a story about racial discrimination and lack of understanding .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: andrew is so complex and emotional from the very beginning that the audience immediately accepts him as a human being , and only the society has troubles with it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in other words , it is as far from reality as from the academy awards .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: further more , there are other annoying problems .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to this day no serious filmmaker has dared to speculate about the future in more than 50 years from now .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this has not been done for obvious reasons , because the filmmakers are well aware of the fact that they lack the knowledge and imagination to perform such a difficult task .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: columbus is the first to have crossed that line .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the result is , as you might imagine , primitive , unrealistic and incredibly disappointing effort .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the world is simply frozen in time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: neither the society , fashion , culture or values have changed over 200 years .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mom is still working at the kitchen , doing the dishes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when you think back to the late 17th century and then compare it to the world we live in today , you'll see a slightly bigger difference .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i am not saying that everything should change .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is unlikely that the human rights will change , but it's even more unlikely that there will not be any progress in science , technology and fashion .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i suppose it's possible to watch this as a some sort of bizarre fairytale , but it's really hard .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: robin williams is hidden behind c and speaking in a robotic way .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as always he does a decent job , as does sam neill .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it doesn't really matter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is the sentimentality and length that turns this picture into a tiresome experience .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: pretty much like last year's " meet joe black " , this is a primitive and unresolved story which is presented with a splendor and professionalism that it doesn't deserve .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: great actors and a talented crew have worked hard to achieve something that will be instantly forgotten .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when isaac asimov wrote this story , the future seemed far away and magical .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: everything seemed possible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now is the future of asimov's time , and we know that it is not as magical and perfect as it seemed a long time ago .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for the same reasons that the young generation of today can not be amazed by julius verne's " 20 000 leagues under the sea " , so can't we accept this story as a potential reality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: let us hope that next year's " a . i . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: will be more rewarding .
docs.label: negative
